solution_line_template: Lisa spends ${lisa_tshirt} on t-shirts / {lisa_jeans_divisor} = $<<{lisa_tshirt}/{lisa_jeans_divisor}={lisa_jeans}>>{lisa_jeans} on jeans.
She also spends ${lisa_tshirt} on t-shirts * {lisa_coats_multiplier} = $<<{lisa_tshirt}*{lisa_coats_multiplier}={lisa_coats}>>{lisa_coats} on coats.
So Lisa has spent a total of {lisa_tshirt} + {lisa_jeans} + {lisa_coats} = $<<{lisa_tshirt}+{lisa_jeans}+{lisa_coats}={lisa_total}>>{lisa_total}.
She also spends ${lisa_jeans} per pair of jeans * {carly_jeans_multiplier} = $<<{lisa_jeans}*{carly_jeans_multiplier}={carly_jeans}>>{carly_jeans} on jeans.
She then also spends ${lisa_coats} Lisa's cost for coats / {carly_coats_divisor} = $<<{lisa_coats}/{carly_coats_divisor}={carly_coats}>>{carly_coats} on coats.
So Carly has spent a total of {carly_tshirt} + {carly_jeans} + {carly_coats} = $<<{carly_tshirt}+{carly_jeans}+{carly_coats}={carly_total}>>{carly_total}.
Lisa and Carly have therefore spent a total of {lisa_total} + {carly_total} = $<<{lisa_total}+{carly_total}={answer}>>{answer}.
